blocks.text: 20. A load uniformly distributed over a length l rolls across a beam of length l, and the bending moment M due to loading at a point is given by

blocks.description: This equation describes the bending moment at a distance x from one end of the beam.

blocks.text: 21. If V = (v velocity) that makes R (a resistance) a maximum.

blocks.description: This equation relates resistance to the velocity.

blocks.text: 22. A jet of water, moving with velocity v, impinges on a plate moving in the direction of the jet with velocity V. Find v to maximize the rate of transfer of momentum.
23. If R = K_{f}(1 - \sin \theta), find values of θ for which R has a maximum, finding dR and θ as appropriate.
24. Consider a petroglyph hung on a vertical rock face exposed facing south.
25. If M = \frac{w}{l} \left( l - 2 x \right) ^2 - R \sin \theta, for what values of θ will M be a maximum.

blocks.description: This equation relates bending moment to the variables of weight and angle.

blocks.text: 26. If M = \frac{w}{l} \left( 1 - \sin \theta \right) ^{2} = 0^{*}, determine a section of a length l for the beam loaded with a uniform load over finite span, and establish.
27. It is required to determine an angle of 45° that is to maximize M. In order to maximize bending moment, a maximum.
The final equation should be solved by plotting, a value being assumed for l.
